an1.258:1.1: “The foremost of my laywomen in first going for refuge is Sujātā Seniyadhītā.
an1.259:1.1: … as a donor is Visākhā, Migāra’s mother.
an1.260:1.1: … who are very learned is Khujjuttarā.
an1.261:1.1: … who dwell in love is Sāmāvatī.
an1.263:1.1: … who give fine things is Suppavāsā Koliyadhītā.
an1.264:1.1: … who care for the sick is the laywoman Suppiyā.
an1.265:1.1: … who have experiential confidence is Kātiyānī.
an1.266:1.1: … who are intimate is the householder Nakula’s mother.
an1.267:1.1: … whose confidence is based on oral transmission is the laywoman Kāḷī of Kuraraghara.”
